API Reference¶

HTTP API¶

These are the web hooks:

GET /files/¶

Lists all the files in JSON format.

GET /files/<str:file_id>/¶

Provides the date created, date modified, and size of the file whose name is equal to file_id.

Source Code Reference¶

file_monitor¶

Implementation of watchdog, which allows cross-platform monitoring of files.

class app.file_monitor.UpdateDatabaseHandler(testing=False)[source]¶

Starts celery tasks to update the database on file events.

on_created(event)[source]¶

Triggered when a new file is created, which now must be recorded to the Database

on_deleted(event)[source]¶

Triggered when a file is deleted, which now must be deleted from the Database

on_modified(event)[source]¶

Triggered when a file is modified, which now must be modified in the Database

on_moved(event)[source]¶

Triggered when a file is moved, which now must be deleted from the Database

app.file_monitor.schedule_observer(path='/Users/jwickens/Envs/kazoup-demo/app/example_files', testing=False)[source]¶

Creates an file directory observer and schedules it to use the UpdateDabaseHandler that in turn calls the Celery tasks.

tasks¶

Methods to update the database in response to changes to the directory.

Defines the tasks that update the database with new files. Some tasks are meant to be run locally and are not celery tasks.

class app.tasks.DatabaseTask[source]¶

Ensures that tasks connect and disconnect to the database.

file_name(location)[source]¶

Extracts the file name out of the location

mapping(location, stat)[source]¶

Provides a dictionary to easily extract information from location and stat that is relevent to the Archive model.

app.tasks.discover_files(location='/Users/jwickens/Envs/kazoup-demo/app/example_files', testing=False, immediate=False)[source]¶

Walks through a given location to disover all unknown files. If immediate is not False it must provide a db_session object.

app.tasks.verify_file(file_obj, location='/Users/jwickens/Envs/kazoup-demo/app/example_files', testing=False)[source]¶

Checks to see if a given file still exists and still has the same attributes. Syncronizes any changes.

app.tasks.verify_files(location='/Users/jwickens/Envs/kazoup-demo/app/example_files', testing=False)[source]¶

Goes through the files table and starts the verify_file task for each file record.

models¶

Defines the Archive model which defines how I store file objects.

Defines the SQLAlchemy models to store the apps data.

class app.models.Archive(**kwargs)[source]¶

The model representation SQLAlchemy must use to store files into the database.

serialize[source]¶

Returns a python dictionary representation of the file for easy serialization to JSON

resources¶

Defines the HTTP resources GET /files/ and GET /files/<str:file_id>/.

Defines API endpoints using the Flask-RESTful extension.

class app.resources.FileInfo[source]¶

“An implementation of the flask-restful Resource that defines get to return a serialized Archive object.

get(file_name)[source]¶
Parameters:file_name (string) – the name of the file to look up.
class app.resources.FileList[source]¶

“An implementation of the flask-restful Resource that defines get to return a list of all Archive objects, serializing them.

views¶

This module is more of a place keeper than anything.

app.views.index()[source]¶

Hello, World!

setup.config¶

This is made to be at once flexible yet extendable.

Configuration settings for all application components

class app.setup.config.CeleryConfig[source]¶

Global Celery configurations, to be subclassed for further refinements.

class app.setup.config.DatabaseConfig(database_file='app.db')[source]¶

Provides standardized Database configuration object

class app.setup.config.FlaskConfig[source]¶

Development flask configuration

class app.setup.config.FlaskTestingConfig[source]¶

Testing flask configuration

setup.create_flask¶

The flask factory. Allows flexibility to define a different config objects, which is important for testing.

app.setup.create_flask.create_flask(flask_config, database_config)[source]¶

A factory that outputs a flask app given config objects

setup.database¶

Defines helper functions to create database sessions and bind them to mappings.

app.setup.database.create_base(Base, engine)[source]¶

Creates the tables :param Base: a SQLAlchemy DeclarativeBase instance. :param engine: an SQLAlchemy engine.

app.setup.database.get_engine(database_uri)[source]¶

Returns an SQLAlchemy engine given a database uri.

app.setup.database.get_session_from_engine(engine)[source]¶

Provides a database session, and also calls initialize_base. :param engine: an SQLAlchemy engine to connect to the database.

app.setup.database.get_session_from_uri(database_uri)[source]¶

Shortcut to :func`get_session_from_engine`

app.setup.database.initialize_base(db_session)[source]¶

Binds the models with session.

utils.tests¶

This module contains all application tests.

Defines unittests for flask components of the app.

utils¶

Other scripts in this module help set up the app’s environment. For instance, “create_random_files.sh” will create lots of random files in the app/example_files folder.
